fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The release notes links for versions 8.14 and 8.15 in [https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap] lead to 404 pages.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Visit https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap
 # Click on the Release notes link for 8.14
 # Visit https://www.atlassian.com/software/jira/download-eap
 # Click on the Release notes link for 8.15

h3. Expected Results

At steps 2 and 3, the user is taken to the appropriate release notes.
h3. Actual Results

At steps 2 and 3, the user is presented with a 404 page.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Release notes lead to 404 pages

fields.description:
When defining a quick filter we want to use something proven so we don't risk having typos or wrong JQL.   This work will be done using Issue Navigator.

We already have a mechanism for handling this, which is saving a filter.

I can design, fix, edit, and finally save my filter, and then I want to use that for a quick filter.  Why can't I just load that in?  

I would like to have two options: type in raw JQL (like today) or *add a Named filter.*
fields.summary: Use Saved Filter as Quick Filter

fields.description:
This request is about the Insight plugin

We would like Insight to allow referencing users in objects comments (using @username) in list mode.  It is actually possible to do this in the object edit mode, but it would be more practical if we could do it in the detailed view of the list mode.  Other users told me that it was possible in our old 6.x version, but not anymore on our 8.6.x version.
fields.summary: Insight plugin: allow referencing users in comments (list mode)

fields.description:
Currently, in Jira Software, the *Administer projects* permissions required whenever a user wants to alter the *Start date* and *Release date* fields of a version in the *Releases* tab.

However, larger organizations tend to have more defined roles, and granting the entire set of permissions associated with the *Administer projects* permission could be considered as excessive or even as a security concern under certain conditions.

Because of that, it would be helpful to Jira System Administrators if they were able to divide the permissions included in the *Administer projects* permission, allowing them to grant access to certain functions that users need to have access to, without granting this larger set of project administration permissions.

In this particular case, we would like to have the ability to set the *Start* and *Release dates* associated with the *Versions* in the *Release* section of a project.
fields.summary: Allow users to set releases' Start and Release Dates without the Administer Projects permission

fields.description:
On using Russian plain text Language in Customised Batching Templates, we are getting a wrong encoding in the outgoing notification. Below are the sample replication steps
 * Ensure that Batching Email notifications are enabled
 * Modify the footer.vm as per [Customizing email content (batched notifications)|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver0813/customizing-email-content-batched-notifications-1027138367.html]
 * Include sample Russian Text
 * Repackage the 'batchers-x.x.x.jar' file
 * The outgoing notification has a wrong encoding
 !Screenshot 2020-12-17 at 6.28.46 PM.png|width=360,height=171!

Proposed solution is to Support Russian plain text Language in Customised Batching Templates
fields.summary: Support Russian plain text Language in Customised Batching Templates

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The max-width attribute in header navigation dropdown menus causes items with long names to be cut short. 

This can be a problem if, for example, there are multiple boards with long but similar names that are only differentiated by the end of the names. The maximum width of the dropdown menus in the header navigation cuts off the useful part of the board names, which makes it impossible to know which one is being selected.

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove the max-width attribute for the items in the header navigation so that the menus expand to be wider when options with long names are present.

Alternately, add a hover tooltip element to display the full name for each item in the list.
 
h3. Workaround 

To work around this, shorter names can be used for dashboards, boards, plans, etc.
fields.summary: Board names and other menu items are cut off by maximum width of header navigation menus
Jira menu bar Icons are too big

fields.description:
h3. Issue summary

Changing the colour for "Header navigation - highlight background colour" in Look and Feel configuration isn't working when the Header-background colour is changed to white or any light colour. It shows grey colour of header navigation.
h3. Steps to reproduce
 # Go to Administration > System > Look and Feel
 # Modify the colour of *Header - background colour* to #ffffff
 # Modify the colour for *"Header navigation - highlight background colour"*
 # Refresh the page and select any menu in header.

h3. Expected results

The selected colour should change the background colour of the *Header navigation - highlight background colour* colours.
  
h3. Actual results

The Header navigation - highlight background colour is showing grey.

h3. Workaround
No workaround at this moment
fields.summary: "Header navigation - highlight background colour" does not effect

fields.description:
h3. Issue description
It's possible to add a custom field to any screens regardless of the custom field context. If the custom field is configured to apply to only specific project + issue type, the custom field can still be added to a screen associated to the specific issue type.

It's as expected that the field will not appear in the screen eventually, but this allows fields to be added to screens without governance and it causes confusion especially to admins. For example, comparing the number of fields in the screen configuration vs the actual issue screen and the number of fields appear as the options during bulk change.

h3. Suggestion
Take the custom field context configuration into account when a custom field is being added to a screen by either
* do not suggest the custom field if the context is not applicable to the specific screen
* show implications of adding the custom field to the screen if the custom field has a non-global context
fields.summary: Check custom field context when adding a custom field to an issue screen

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Problem with the navigation bar and the issue view page when the column bar is having a long list or details and the browser window is small. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # For example, go to the issue column in the Jira instance screen
 # Make the browser screen a little shot 
 # If the issue has a long list saved filter or details 
 # The top bar shifts upward and disappears from Screens when clicked on the issue icon 
 # Also, the user is unable to scroll down to the manage filters from the issue view page.

h3. Expected Results

The project issue tab bar should remain on the screen - able to replicate in Jira 8.5.3 version.
User should be able to scroll down to the Manage filters option from the issue view.
 
h3. Actual Results

The project issue tab bar should remain on the screen disappear  - able to replicate in Jira 8.13 version.
The scroll doesn't move down to the filter options rather scrolls the main page.

h3. Workaround
The maximum number of filters and recently viewed issues in the *Issue* menu can be reduced by following the steps in this KB article:
* [How to customise number of "filters" and "recent issues" on JIRA applications Issues menu|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/how-to-customise-number-of-filters-and-recent-issues-on-jira-applications-issues-menu-598840835.html]
fields.summary: Problem with the navigation bar and issue view in Jira 8.13

fields.description:
Jira provides a very generic message saying "Something went wrong" when the SAML response is anything other than successful authentication. 

Example: Jira received the below response to an unsuccessful login attempt. 
{code}
2020-12-09 22:35:37,177-0800 http-nio-8080-exec-13 ERROR anonymous 1355x9604x1 1pqlvb  /plugins/servlet/samlconsumer [c.a.p.a.i.web.filter.ErrorHandlingFilter] Received invalid SAML response: The status code of the Response was not Success, was urn:oasis:names:tc:SAML:2.0:status:Responder -> Access to this resource is not currently available to you. Please contact your supervisor if you have questions.
{code}

To this, the page saying "Something went wrong" (screenshot attached) was presented to the user which is not very useful. 

Suggestion: We can add the ability to customize the error page to something more meaningful, like who exactly to contact aside from just generically "your Jira administrator"
fields.summary: Provide more meaningful message to SAML responses

fields.description:
I have seen JRASERVER-2698 and many other tickets about versions in multiple projects, so I understand that is not possible; so I propose an alternative...

Here's the scenario...
 * I add versions "1.1" and "2.2" to project A
 * I add versions "1.1" and "2.2" to project B
 * I set the fix version of tickets in each project
 * I create a filter that lists tickets from both projects : "project in (A,B)"
 * I order the results by version: "project in (A,B) order by fixVersion"

Today this fails; my filter shows all tickets from project A, ordered by version; then all tickets from project B, ordered by version...
 * key=A-001 fixVersion=1.1
 * key=A-002 fixVersion=1.1
 * key=A-003 fixVersion=1.2
 * key=A-004 fixVersion=1.2
 * key=B-001 fixVersion=1.1
 * key=B-002 fixVersion=1.2

I'm guessing this is because the versions in projects A and B have different UIDs

Can you make it so the ordering function looks at version names instead of UIDs, and the filter above is therefore ordered correctly?
fields.summary: Order by version name (not ID)
Order by version name (not ID)

fields.description:
h3. Problem

After a timeout, the job scheduler gets stuck on the database side with a status 'A' (Already Running) in the rundetails table, the only workaround is to restart the entire Jira instance.
h3. Proposed Solution

It would better if the job scheduler could drop the previous run and start new after some timeout *OR* at least we have a possibility to do it without restart or redeploy plugins.
fields.summary: Improve Job Scheduler functionality

fields.description:
As a Kanban user, I would like to set a single WIP limit that applies to two (or more) columns so that I can have more flexibility in how I allocate my resources and can achieve a smoother flow of work.

 

There are many examples online of Kanban board having "Doing / Done" columns for "Development" or "Testing" and most of them have a SINGLE WIP limit that applies to both of those sub-columns.    Giving Jira the ability to apply a single WIP number to more than one column can significantly improve the flow of work.

For example you could have 2 tickets in "dev-doing" and 2 tickets in "dev-done" all adding up to 4.

Or you could have 3 tickets in "dev-doing" and 1 ticket in "dev-done" adding up to 4.

 

In the most general case, you could set a SINGLE WIP number for the entire board.  This is a nice gentle way to introduce WIP limits.  You could tell the team-- no more than 20 cards on the entire board.
fields.summary: CAPWIP: Set WIP limit across more than one column

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue happens after re-enabling a plugin (that was previously disabled) and it affects only the display of the gadgets provided by the plugin. 
 After a plugin is disabled its respective gadgets would return the below error when trying to load them (which is expected as the plugin is disabled) 
 *'This gadget cannot be displayed on your dashboard. This could be due to a licensing problem or an application error. If you need this gadget, contact your administrator for assistance. Otherwise, you can remove it from your dashboard.'*
 !Screenshot 2020-12-15 at 15.10.25.png|width=275,height=148!

However, after re-enabling the plugin and then refreshing the dashboard that contains the gadget, the same error is still displayed as if the plugin was still disabled. Hence all users trying to access those gadgets (provided by the previously disabled plugin) will find the same error message.
 It takes approximately 15 minutes or longer for the gadget to be properly loaded again.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a plugin that can be used in a gadget (we were able to reproduce using *Tempo timesheet* and *Xray* plugins).
 # Add a gadget that uses that plugin to a dashboard and keep the dashboard open in that tab.
 # Open the manage apps *in a separate tab*.
 # Disable the plugin you installed in step 1.
 # Back to the first tab, refresh the dashboard. You should see this error which is expected:
 !Screenshot 2020-12-15 at 15.10.25.png|thumbnail!
 # Now back to the second tab, enable the plugin that you disabled in step 4.
 # Back to the first tab, refresh the dashboard again.

h3. Expected Results

The gadget should be rendering properly as soon as the plugin is enabled.
h3. Actual Results

The gadget still shows the error as if the plugin was still disabled.

Sometimes, waiting for approximately 15 minutes and then refreshing the dashboard might load the correct plugin state again, which fixes the gadget issue.
h3. Notes
 * This issue only happens when disabling then re-enabling the plugin in a separate tab while the gadget is open in another tab. Reproducing the steps in the same tab doesn't show the issue.

h3. Workaround
 * Wait a few minutes (15 minutes) for the cache to be properly loaded again.
fields.summary: Latency in Gadget data refresh after disabling and re-enabling a plugin

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently file replication for disaster recovery is completely in the hands of the individual customers to implement, resulting in a wide variety of different solutions. While that gives the flexibility to implement something that fits well into the existing infrastructure framework they already have in place, it also has the drawback of not being directly supported by Atlassian while at the same time _parts_ of it, i.e. the native Jira side, +is+ supported. This leads to a lot of "passing the ball" back and forth between Atlassian Support and the customer.

The file replication is also not (natively) confirmed in any way, leading to the possibility of files not yet having been synced to the DR location without an easy to way check.
h3. Suggestion

Native file replication of files needed for disaster recovery.

From customer testimonial:
{quote}Utilizing S3 based storage for attachments is our internal first step to providing the ability for our Jira DC instance to failover between physical data centers. It is essential for us to have DR support in the products that we support internally. Currently, in order to achieve some level of DR capability, we run a background process to synchronize files across our physical data centers.

Having Jira support this natively would be our preferred option, and in our opinion, would place Jira Data Center in a different class of application, that approaches the level we expect from a true Enterprise level application. It would also almost completely eliminate the need for NFS to run this application. From our research it appears that aside from attachments, there appears to be only 1 additional file that needs to be shared within the cluster.
{quote}
fields.summary: Native support for S3 based storage to handle file replication for disaster recovery
Jira installer can't drop a column from compressed table

fields.description:
h3. Problem definition
There are two importers in Jira:
* Importer available to all users: go to Issues > Import issues from CSV (limited possibilities)
* Importer available to administrators: go to Jira settings > System > External System Import (full possibilities)

Currently, there is no documentation that explain the first option (Import issues from CSV) and differences between limited and full version of Importer.

On top of that, the limited importer available to users has restrictions on many system fields that cannot be mapped during the import, and with the lack of the proper documentation, it is difficult for users to know which fields they can or cannot map.

h3. Suggested resolution
Write a clear documentation on:
* "Import issues from CSV" importer (the documentation already exists for [External System Import|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/importing-data-from-csv-938847533.html]
* Explain differences and limitation of "Import issues from CSV" importer, as opposed to "External System Import", when it comes to available fields that can be mapped.
fields.summary: Provide clarity on differences between two available CSV importers in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Editing a workflow by removing statuses and re-adding the same sometimes fails with the below Error

Workflow publish error.JPG


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Import the Change-Workflow- Original.jwb workflow. (attached herewith)
 # Copy the imported worflow 
 # Associate the copied workflow to a new workflow scheme. 
 # Now please follow the video attached and start editing the copied workflow. (screen-capture (1).webm)
 #  Try to publish the changes and you will see the below error message. 


h3. Expected Results
Workflow should have been published without any errors

h3. Actual Results

You see the below error in the Front end. No error in the backend logs. 


h3. Workaround

# Remove each status at a time and publish the workflow. After removing three statuses, the publish succeeds. Now start adding back the statuses and this time it goes through fine.  Also shown in the video capture
fields.summary: Editing a workflow by removing statuses and re-adding them sometimes fails with Error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
This bug was found and shared by a vendor working on Structure Plugin(https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/34717/structure-project-management-at-scale\) on a test instance of JIRA.

Their plugin [Structure Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/34717/structure-project-management-at-scale] \- includes a Jira Dashboard Gadget. Structure Gadget uses Atlassian dropdown elements \(one of them shown on the picture\). 
If a user tries to open this dropdown menu the following error happens in the console \(AUI 8.5.0\):   

\{code}
Uncaught TypeError: parent.hasAttribute is not a function
    at getClosestIgnoredElement \(skate-0.12.6.js:1236\)
    at MutationObserver.documentObserverHandler \(skate-0.12.6.js:92\)
\{code}

on attempt to call parent.hasAttribute where parent is a document JS object. 

Document object doesn't have this method of Element. Safeguard "parent \!== document" doesn't helps because two different document objects are used. Gadgets on Jira App Dashboard are shown in iframe elements \(so gadget has his own document JS object\). 
An dropdown menu is added to main page document(not to gadget iframe\) and because of that parent=addedNodes[0].parentNode(where addedNodes[0] is added dropdown\) is outer page document. At the same time  'document' var in getClosestIgnoredElement\(\) method points to gadget iframe document object. As a result parent \!== document is true.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Try to open this dropdown menu in the Jira Dasboard gadget provided by the Structure plugin

h3. Expected Results
Work normally as expected

h3. Actual Results
The following error happens in the console on attempt to call parent.hasAttribute where parent is a document JS object (AUI 8.5.0):   

\{code}
Uncaught TypeError: parent.hasAttribute is not a function
    at getClosestIgnoredElement \(skate-0.12.6.js:1236\)
    at MutationObserver.documentObserverHandler \(skate-0.12.6.js:92\)
\{code}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Error 'parent.hasAttribute is not a function' JS if use AUI dropdown on gadget

fields.description: As a user i want to access the infrastructure when i click.

fields.description:
Currently when using JIT provided by [SSO for Atlassian Server and Data Center|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1216096/sso-for-atlassian-server-and-data-center?hosting=server&tab=overview], users are updated every time they log in.

This can cause group membership from being lost if the groups are being managed directly in Jira's internal directory.

It would be great if we had an option to only update the new users being created.

fields.description:
h3. Problem statement
When users acquire commercial (Server, DC) licenses, it allows them to build an environment locally, or use external services like AWS Cloud to host their solution.

In many case we offer documentation for AWS instances, though not always we have an equivalent version for local environments. 

It might be useful to split our documentation between these setups, as there are circumstances where customers cannot host their solution on Cloud, and might need references using self-hosted servers. Also, different factors need to be considered when choosing one of the above,
fields.summary: Split our documentation between AWS Cloud and on-premise

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When obtaining issue information using the GET api/2/issue REST API call, it's possible to select specific fields to be returned (e.g comments), but it's not possible to remove certain information from that field at the response (e.g. comment body)

h3. Suggested Solution
Allow users to restrict which information is returned by each field when using GET api/2/issue.
fields.summary: Allow users to remove elements from the api/2/issue REST API call response

fields.description:
Currently, for larger environments where there is a large number of groups, it can be troublesome to configure issue security levels for cases where the issue should be accessible to different teams. As an example, we can consider the following use-case:

# Issue should be available to be worked by the 1st-level response team. This team decides to escalate it to a 2nd-level response team.
# Now the 2nd-level response team must also have access to this issue. They assess the situation and must include an additional team that is specialized in certain segments.
# Now these 3 teams must have access to the request.

These use-cases can be unmanageable for an instance that has a large number of groups in each of these levels. It would be helpful if the Issue Security Level field would work as a *Group Picker (multiple groups)* custom field type.
fields.summary: Allow Issue Security Level to be dynamically set.
Allow webhook event type in the URL variable substitutions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Calendar plugin ics export only contains data up to three months in the future
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Install Jira Calendar plugin
 * Add the Jira Calendar gadget to a dashboard
 * Set the gadgets too filter issues on a field (ex.due date)
 * Create 5 issues and set for each of those the due date on the first day of every month for 2020/2021
 * Browse the dashboard and clic on the export in Ical format options:
 !Screenshot_2020-12-05_at_15_45_50.jpg|width=426,height=230!
 * Inspect the export calendar.ics file and notice that it *only contains events up to three months in the future.*

*Note*: Worth to mention that the Calendar plugin is now listed as *unsupported*. 

h3.Expected Results
Export should contains all events

h3. Actual Results
Export contains only events up to three months in the future

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Calendar plugin ics export only contains data up to three months in the future

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

unable to create linked issue from an issue which is linked to an epic when lacking edit issue permission in the Epic project
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create 2 projects A and B. Create an Epic in project A
 * Create a Story in project B and link it to the Epic
 * Go back to project A and revoke the *edit issue permission* to the user
 * Notice that at that point it is not possible anymore to create a new Story in project B and link it to the Epic in project A and the following error is thrown out into logs:

{code:java}
Error creating issue: 
Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: You do not have permission to edit the following issues: TEST-1, TEST2-1.
{code}
This is expected by default behaviour even if the error message on the UI is not very clear as per the following bug:

[Unable to link Epic without Edit Issue permissions|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-20770]:


 !Screenshot 2020-12-05 at 15.56.40.png|thumbnail! 
 Also the confusion come from the fact that even without having the Edit issue permission in project A, user is able to see those Epics in the dropdown list in the Epic Link.

For this situation we have an open feature request:

[Epic Link field allows selection of unlinkable Epics without warning/error|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-13986]
 * Now open again the issue view of the Story previously created still linked to the Epic with the user that is at this point lacking the edit issue permission in project A.
 go to *More>Create Linked Issue* and observe that it is *not possible to create the linked issue* and an error is thrown out into logs:
{code:java}
/secure/QuickCreateLinkedIssue.jspa [c.a.j.bc.issue.DefaultIssueService] Error creating issue: 
com.atlassian.jira.exception.CreateException: You do not have permission to edit issue TEST-1.
{code}
and on the UI the following:
 !Screenshot_2020-12-05_at_16_27_02.jpg|thumbnail!

In summary it is *not possible create the linked issue because the Story is linked to an epic that the user cannot edit* (because of lack of edit issue permission)

*Note 1*: That Project B must *be either a Business (Jira Core) or Jira Service Desk project* to have the create linked issue feature.

*Note 2*: Notice that this is not reproducible in *7.13.0 LTS* since that version was affected by another bug When create new issue, Epic Link not suggest all matched epics and was not possible at all to link an Epic from another project.

*Note 3*: Issue is not reproducible in *8.5.0 LTS*. It is possible to link the Epic without having edit issue permission in the Epic project (*which is not the expected behaviour*) and it is possible to create then the linked issue.
h3. Expected Results

It should be possible to create the linked issue from the Story *disregarding the fact that the user lack edit issue permission on the Epic linked to the story*.
h3. Actual Results

It is not possible to create a linked issue
h3. Workaround
 * Grant again the user the edit issue permission in the project where the linked epic come from
 *OR*
 * Create a new issue and use the More> link issue functionality to link it to the Story which is linked to the Epic where the user lack permission
fields.summary: unable to create linked issue from an issue which is linked to an epic when lacking edit issue permission in the Epic project

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Jira Cloud has a completely different display for view issue details.  This is most commonly refered to as "The New Issue View" for lack of a more concise term.  More details about it are explained in [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-core-cloud/docs/what-is-the-new-jira-issue-view/]

However Jira Server and Data Center do not utilize this new issue view at all.  Users would like to see the same features in Data Center/Server editions as exist in the Cloud edition.
h3. Suggested Solution

Implement the option for the same 'New Issue View' for on premise editions of Jira
h3. Why this is important
 * UI consistency between Jira editions is very important towards not confusing users
 * Simplify testing for developers that would want to create apps for Jira regardless of Cloud/Server/DC
fields.summary: Bring the New Issue View in Jira Cloud to Jira Server/Data Center

fields.description:
Currently, the "Send Email" feature in Jira under ⚙ >System>Send Email adds all the mentioned mail recipients to a single mail. If the mail recipients contain one or more 'invalid' email addresses, delivery to all email recipients fails on some SMTP mail servers.

When Jira needs to send a notification to multiple users, Jira will build 1 email per user and put this user in the “To:” header of that email and sends the mail. This will ensure that emails are sent individually and any 'invalid' email address does not affect 'valid' email addresses.
However, when the Send Email feature, needs to send an email to multiple users, this action only builds 1 single email and adds all the users into the “To:” header. This could cause issues with some SMTP mail servers, if 1 single email address is invalid, the whole email is not sent, thereby affecting 'valid' users.
It would be great if the feature uses the behavior of Jira notification and send separate mails for different mail addresses so that mail to all 'valid' addresses are sent even if the recipient list contains one or more 'invalid' email addresses.
fields.summary: Send mails individually from Recipients list in "Send email" action

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When attempting to start watching an issue from the Jira issue view, the API request's body contains "dummy=true" which is incompatible with the JSON Content-Type and might cause the functionality to break if interfering with some WAF rules.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an issue in Jira
 # Intercept the HTTP requests in your browser (open the network panel in developer tools)
 # Add yourself as a watcher by clicking on "*Start watching this issue*" link.

h3. Expected Results

The body should contain the username in an acceptable JSON format.
h3. Actual Results

The body contains *"dummy=true"* which is "www-form-url-encoded" while the Content-Type is "application/json". This incorrect Content-Type is against HTTP standards and is incompatible with some WAF rules, which might cause the functionality to fail as the request gets blocked.
 !myselfasawatcher.png|width=311,height=127! 
  
h3. Workaround

If this is interfering with the WAF rules and the request is blocked due to content type incompatibility, you can use the "add watcher" functionality and add yourself by inserting your name:
 * Click on the circle that contains the watchers' number (next to "Start watching this issue")
 * Insert your username manually in the text field.
 * This will send the request with a proper JSON body containing the username to be added as watcher.
 !userWatcher.png|width=301,height=123!
fields.summary: "Start watching this issue" request payload type is incompatible with Content-Type "application/json"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Change password option in Outgoing SMTP mail server doesn't update the authentication credential password.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# *Configure new SMTP mail server* in Jira Administration » System » Outgoing mail. Make sure the connection is tested successful and add it.
# Check the mail server password in {{mailserver}} database table.
# *Edit* the same outgoing mail server added in previous step.
# Check the *Change Password* option and enter random password.
# *Test Connection* from the SMTP Mail Server setup page.
# *Update* the mail server configuration with the new password.
# Check the mail server password in {{mailserver}} database table.
(The same applies to Jira incoming mail server -- reported in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-71771)

h3. Expected Results
* *Test Connection* should fail with the random password.
* *mailpassword* value in {{mailserver}} database table should be updated to new encrypted password.

h3. Actual Results
* *Test Connection* still tested successful with the random password.
* *mailpassword* value in {{mailserver}} database table remains with the same encrypted password.

Issue is reproducible in latest Jira release (8.14) and Jira releases >8.10.0, but not reproducible in Jira 7.13.x nor Jira 8.0.

h3. Workaround
* Delete and re-create the mail server with the new password. 
OR
* Update the base64-encoded-password into the database table:
{code}UPDATE mailserver SET mailpassword='<base64-encoded password>' WHERE name = '<mail server name in Jira>';{code}
fields.summary: Change password doesn't update the mail server setup with the new password for Outgoing Mail

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After setting up a Disaster Recovery as per [the official guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/disaster-recovery-guide-for-jira-692782022.html#DisasterRecoveryGuideforJira-definitions], at some stage (see replication steps below), folders with stripped names will be created in the secondary location configured in JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Spin up a 1-node DC instance.
# Set up DR Replication, (including checking the checkboxes at least avatars & attachments) 
# Do Not click “Synchronize” (may not be important, but keeps things clearer for the test)
# Shut down the node. double check that there’s not any “secondary” folder in the shared home (this is the default DR replication location)
# Start the node up again and wait. Once the healthchecks fire, the “secondary” directory should be created with the spurious entries. 

h3. Expected Results

Only the folders from the shared home folder should be replicated to the secondary location, no spurious folders should be created in the secondary location.

h3. Actual Results

Empty folders like below will get created outside of the 'data' folder:

{panel}
$ du -sh ./*
32K ./chments
32K ./vatars
{panel}

h3. Workaround

This is a minor bug which has no impact on the actual replication, hence can be safely ignored
fields.summary: Replication of JIRA shared home in Disaster Recovery setup creates redundant folders with stripped names

Configure your Jira instance to work in a cluster*, but it doesn't expand on what can be used as a value for the parameter *jira.node.id*.

This parameter can accept any string as long as it's unique on the cluster. Clarifying this can assist in deflecting questions from the customer.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira DC replication might lose some events or make Lucene not up to date with DB, see related JRASERVER-68528, JRASERVER-68400

h3. Suggested Solution
* Provide the versioning feature for replicated entities in DC
* Change the way how replicated operations are replayed 

In the fixed version: 
* we have added *versioning of all entities* - now every change which triggers an issue, comment or worklog reindex bumps this entity version (bumping the version is only triggered by user actions, not full/background re-index)
* on both server and DC there is a task running every 5sec which *checks the consistency* of the recent (last 15 sec) changes in the index and *re-applies deletes* if there was a late update which has overridden the delete (conditional updates do not solve this problem); this task checks for the consistency of updates as well to handle corner cases like thread was gone after updating the DB (for DC this is the index replication table, for server the entity version table) but before updating the local index 

h3. Workaround 
None
fields.summary: Provide the versioning feature for replicated entities

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Dropdowns in password policy are broken.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # JIRA Administration > System > Password Policy
 # Select Custom

h3. Expected Results

No problem with UI
h3. Actual Results

The UI of below dropdowns is broken
 * Combination
 * Old Password
 * User Information

!password_policy_dropdown_broken.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

A Jira system administrator can create a CSS modification to work-around this. To do this, you will need to go into the announcement banner and paste this particular code to appear. This will force the CSS for this particular element to render more appropriately.
{code:java}
<!-- workaround for JRASERVER-71854 -->
<style type="text/css">
form.aui:not(.aui-legacy-forms) select:not([size]) 
{background-image: url()}
</style> 
{code}
Then click Set Banner to save this change. The next time any admin reloads the page to visit this Password policy page the select element should then render correctly.

h3. Issue Summary

Issue Type Screen Scheme does not reflect correctly on all node after the scheme is updated. The node who make the change contains the correct value, and even though the other nodes receive cache invalidation message, they display the incorrect previous value.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Setup a 2 node DC cluster (I used Jira 8.5.8)
 # Create a blank SCRUM project. This will create an issue type scheme: _KEY: Scrum Issue Type Screen Scheme,_ with two issue type defined within: Default, and Bug
 # (i) You can setup TRACE logging on _com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq, com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheManager, com.atlassian.jira.cluster.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator, net.sf.ehcache.distribution_ , and/or enable SQL log if you wish to review log as shared in the [Expected Results] section below
 # Setup two browsers, and log in one browser to node 1, the other to node 2.
 # Open Network Tools on each, then visit Network Tab and choose Disable cache, so that we always get the fresh page from the server
 # Edit the Issue Type Screen Scheme, EG, [http://NODE/secure/admin/ConfigureIssueTypeScreenScheme.jspa?id=10000|http://node/secure/admin/ConfigureIssueTypeScreenScheme.jspa?id=10000] on each browser
 # On node1, edit "*Bug*" to be the *KEY: Scrum Default Screen Scheme*
 # Refresh page of node 1
 # Refresh page of node 2
 # (i) Note that both nodes show the correct values
 # Now on node 2, edit "*Bug*" to be the *KEY: Scrum Bug Screen Scheme*
 # Refresh Node 1
 # (i) Note that Node 1 incorrectly shows KEY: Scrum Default Screen Scheme
 # You can now refresh node 1 and node 2 as much as you want and the incorrect value will stick on Node 1

(i) You do not have to switch change from Node 1, to Node 2. Even two sequential change on Node 1 will cause the bug, provided that the _ConfigureIssueTypeScreenScheme_ is accessed on a different node in between changes

(i) This is on an individual ITS Scheme basis. IE, if you change a scheme once, then change a different scheme once, both changes will apply to all nodes

(i) This can be triggered with just a single change to the Issue Type Screen Scheme. The reproduction steps show multiple changes because this was the most reliable path to replicate the problem.
h3. Expected Results

Both node 1 and node 2 show the same Screen Scheme configuration. In our test:
 * Default = KEY: Scrum Default Screen Scheme
 * Issue Type Bug = KEY: Scrum Bug Screen Scheme

When creating a new issue of type Bug in the relevant project, the fields shown are that of the scheme that was set. IE: Issue Type Bug will get fields for screen in _KEY: Scrum Bug Screen Scheme_
h3. Actual Results

(x) Node 1 incorrectly shows _KEY: Scrum Default Screen Scheme._

(x) When creating a new issue of type Bug in the relevant project, the fields shown are that of the incorrect _Key: Scrum Default Screen Scheme_
h4. Cache Log: Node 1

(i) Cache replication completes for the update on node1 - _Done replicating cache to queues_

(i) Cache replication message is received fastly for the update on node2: _RMICachePeer for cache com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.issuetype.DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager.schemeCache: remote remove received for key_
{code:java}
tail -f atlassian-jira.log | grep -E "Done replicating cache to queues: com\.atlassian\.jira\.issue\.fields\.screen\.issuetype\.DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager\.schemeCache|remote remove received for key" {code}
{code:java}
Click Edit on Node 1
Update to ASDF Scrum Default Screen Scheme on Node1....

Refresh Node 1....

Refresh Node 1....
Refresh Node 2....
Result: Node 2 matches Node1
Edit Node 2...

2020-11-24 03:25:45,077+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-9 TRACE admin 205x5058x1 tnooso 192.168.48.1 /secure/admin/EditIssueTypeScreenSchemeEntity.jspa [c.a.j.c.distribution.localq.LocalQCacheReplicator] Done replicating cache to queues: com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.screen.issuetype.DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager.schemeCache, operation: REMOVE, key: 10001, numberOfQueues: 1, timeMillis: 5, stacktrace: java.lang.Throwable

Refresh Node 2....

2020-11-24 03:25:57,704+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-10 admin 205x6948x1 g8fvop /secure/admin/ConfigureIssueTypeScreenScheme.jspa 1ms "SELECT SOURCE_NODE_ID, SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY, SINK_NODE_ID, SINK_NODE_ENTITY, ASSOCIATION_TYPE, SEQUENCE FROM public.nodeassociation WHERE SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY='Project' AND SINK_NODE_ID='10000' AND SINK_NODE_ENTITY='IssueTypeScreenScheme' AND ASSOCIATION_TYPE='ProjectScheme'"
Result = Node 1 shows incorrect "Scrum Default Screen Scheme". Node 2 shows correct Scrum Bug Screen Scheme{code}
h4. SQL Log: Node 2

(/) After the first UPDATE occurred on Node 1, we refresh node 2, and see that it reads from the database - _SELECT ID, ISSUETYPE, SCHEME, FIELDSCREENSCHEME FROM public.issuetypescreenschemeentity._ This results in the Scheme displaying correcty
 (/) At the second UPDATE occuring on Node 2, we can see the DB operation - _UPDATE public.issuetypescreenschemeentity_

Set to Scrum bug screeen scheme on Node 2
2020-11-24 03:25:45,068+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-9 admin 205x5058x1 tnooso /secure/admin/EditIssueTypeScreenSchemeEntity.jspa 3ms "UPDATE public.issuetypescreenschemeentity SET ISSUETYPE='10102', SCHEME='10000', FIELDSCREENSCHEME='10001' WHERE ID='10101'"
2020-11-24 03:25:45,084+0000 http-nio-8080-exec-1 admin 205x5059x1 tnooso /secure/admin/ConfigureIssueTypeScreenScheme.jspa 1ms "SELECT SOURCE_NODE_ID, SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY, SINK_NODE_ID, SINK_NODE_ENTITY, ASSOCIATION_TYPE, SEQUENCE FROM public.nodeassociation WHERE SOURCE_NODE_ENTITY='Project' AND SINK_NODE_ID='10000' AND SINK_NODE_ENTITY='IssueTypeScreenScheme' AND ASSOCIATION_TYPE='ProjectScheme'"
Refresh node 1
Result = Node 1 shows incorrect "Scrum Default Screen Scheme". Node 2 shows correct Scrum Bug Screen Scheme{code}
h4. Note on Cache Invalidation

If you wait without checking any of the ITS Screen Scheme pages for at least 30 minutes, and check again, the bad node will refresh it's value and display correctly. This may be due to the cache invalidation of 30 minute:

{{/jira/jira-components/jira-core/src/main/java/com/atlassian/jira/issue/fields/screen/issuetype/DefaultIssueTypeScreenSchemeManager.java}}
{code:java}
schemeCache = cacheManager.getCache(getClass().getName() + ".schemeCache",
                this::loadIssueTypeScreenScheme,
                new CacheSettingsBuilder().expireAfterAccess(30, TimeUnit.MINUTES).build());{code}
h3. Workaround

A rolling restart of the affected nodes will resolve each instance of the cache not updating.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's a sort of chicken & egg problem. On restart when the system is in Upgrade Mode, we display dismissible/minor warnings in the form of a Johnson Page. In order to dismiss the warnings and continue, we first need to log in to Jira. The default redirect is to login.jsp. However, in order to login via SSO, the login process is different. The browser also has to access the `.../plugins/servlet/samlconsumer`--a url that gets blocked by the same Johnson Filter we're trying to dismiss.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up SSO in a DC instance (say on 8.5)
 # Upgrade a single node.
 ** The node should either have some sort of configuration problem that would prompt a warning Johnson Page, OR:
 ** start the upgraded node with the `-Djira.johnson.simulate.failure=POST_DATABASE_ACTIVATED:warning-dismissible` flag to force a dismissible johnson page to appear (note, you still have to be in upgrade mode for this to work, unfortunately)
 # Click the "Ignore all warnings and continue" button

!Screenshot_2020-10-14 Jira access problem.png!
h3. Expected Results

The warning page gets dismissed and the admin is able to login normally with SSO.
h3. Actual Results

A 503 is returned, and the user is directed to a blank page.
h3. Workarounds

1) Logging in with basic auth or some other mechanism, using the oauth fallback url (needs to be  [enabled|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/bypass-saml-authentication-for-jira-data-center-869009810.html] beforehand)

2) Fixing the minor problems mentioned in the warning and restarting the node is another option.

3) The following JAVA parameter can be added to the nodes during the upgrade `-Djira.startup.warnings.disable=true` which will effectively disable that warning page on first login to the node that's been upgraded (drawback is that the admin will not be notified of any other warnings that might be important for the upgrade)
fields.summary: Dismissing a Johnson Page For Minor Warnings After Upgrading a Node Is Not Compatible With SSO

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In wiki rendered fields (description, comments, etc) when there is a bullet point or numbered list element in a table cell and a list element has a blank line in it, the table breaks when the field is saved.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Here they are:
 # add a table
 # edit a cell
 # add a numbered list or a bullet point list
 # edit the list and make sure there is a blank line in it
 # save the field 

h3. Expected Results

A table with all the information that was filled in it.
h3. Actual Results

You should see something like the following:
||Heading 1||Heading 2||Heading 3||
|Col A1|Col A2|Col A3|
|Test| * Info

same field| |
h3. Workaround


 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: In wiki rendered fields (description, comments, etc) when there is a bullet point or numbered list element in a table cell and a list element has a blank line in it, the table breaks when the field is saved

h3. Issue Summary

After importing some datasets, the names of -agile- certain gadgets are untranslated and have an odd format.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up a 8.14.0 instance.
 # Create a dashboard with some gadgets, e.g. sprint-related ones.
 # Import a dataset.
 # Go to your dashboard.

h3. Expected Results

Gadgets have human-readable labels (names).
h3. Actual Results

Gadgets have MSG keys as names.
h3. Workaround

N/A, just ugly.

 

 

This doesn't happen on 8.13 with same datasets.

Also doesn't happen when importing some other datasets (tested on a locally-created one on 8.13).

Happens to some, but not all gadgets (those from software seem affected, but also others).

Similar to this issue: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/fix-gadget-titles-showing-as-__msg_gadget-in-jira-server-813697086.html]

André

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Whenever a workflow has a condition based on an application link (e.g. Code Committed Condition, No Open Reviews Condition, Unreviewed Code Condition), the condition will be bypassed if the user is not currently authenticated to the other application

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a condition to verify another application to a transition
# Make sure the user attempting the workflow transition is not connected to the other application

h3. Expected Results
Transition is not available as it cannot confirm the condition passes

h3. Actual Results
Transition is available and transitions without problems.
The following is logged
{noformat}
2015-07-08 15:34:15,819 http-bio-8080-exec-13 ERROR petry 934x4530x1 4becn9 192.168.10.136 /browse/TC-1 [domain.workflow.condition.ReviewsCompleteCondition] Error retrieving reviews for ReviewsCompleteCondition (TC-1). Enable logging for the FishEye plugin for more detail.
{noformat}
fields.summary: Fisheye Plugin Workflow Conditions based on applink bypassed when user is not authenticated to other application

fields.description:
Affected versions of Jira Server have a SQL injection vulnerability that has now been fixed by removing the vulnerable HipChat integration plugin.

_*Affected versions:*_
 * versions < 8.14.0

_*Fixed versions:*_
 * 8.14.0

 The plugin is no longer installed in new versions of Jira. However, the removal of the plugin was not back-ported to an LTS release. Therefore, as a workaround, we recommend disabling the plugin.
fields.summary: SQL Injection in Jira Software Server [Integration for HipChat]

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

3rd party automation apps cannot be enabled if they were installed prior to Automation for Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install and start Jira Server 8.13.1
 # Clone and build the Atlassian 3rd party sample app from here: [https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/automation-addon-sample/src/master/automation-thirdparty-sample/]
 # Install the sample app JAR into Jira. An exception is thrown and the app becomes disabled.
 # Install Automation for Jira 7.2.1 app into Jira from here: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/download/apps/1215460/version/300003990]
 # Try to enable the sample app. It hangs and won't enable.

h3. Expected Results

The sample app can be enabled once Automation app is available.
h3. Actual Results

The sample app cannot be enabled. It hangs for a while then remains disabled.
h3. Workaround

A possible workaround is reinstalling the sample app, but this is still very confusing and frustrating for new customers.
fields.summary: 3rd party automation apps cannot be enabled if they were installed prior to Automation for Jira

fields.description:
As a user, I would like to be able to use JQL to search for a text added on the last comment.

When we do a search for a text at the comments, it does check all the comments done, and not only the last one.


Use case:
We would use it for a Slack integration - when the last comment added was using a specific text, we would trigger a notification on Slack.
fields.summary: As a user, I would like to be able to use JQL to search for a text added on the last comment done

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the status of the ticket changed the inactivity tab , the translation for status change is reflecting incorrectly.

For example when we are changing from status "TO DO" to any other status then in English the activity tab shows the status change as " [mysaran|http://localhost:8843/j843/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jiraadmin] changed the status to To Do on [HBHJBHB-32 - wdqwf|http://localhost:8843/j843/browse/HBHJBHB-32]"  

but in polish it shows as "zmienił status z Do zrobienia na "  which means Change status from whereas it should be change status to i.e "Twój status zmienił się na STATUS 2""
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # change the language to polish
 # create a new ticket
 # change the status
 # check the activity tab

h3. Expected Results

when we are changing from status "TO DO" to any other status then in English the activity tab shows the status change as " [mysaran|http://localhost:8843/j843/secure/ViewProfile.jspa?name=jiraadmin] changed the status to To Do on [HBHJBHB-32 - wdqwf|http://localhost:8843/j843/browse/HBHJBHB-32]"  

but in polish it shows as "zmienił status z Do zrobienia na "  which means Change status from whereas it should be change status to i.e "Twój status zmienił się na STATUS 2""
h3. Actual Results

It should show as ""Twój status zmienił się na STATUS 2""" which means change status from
h3. Workaround

no workaround
fields.summary: Wrong translation in polish for status change in jira activity tab

fields.description: As a Jira Administrator, it would be great if the *searchrequest* table included additional information about filters such as their creation date, the date when they were last updated, and when they were last run.
fields.summary: Include additional information about filters in the database

fields.description:
When we install Jira, the {{jira-administrators}} group already has all the other Global Permissions, except for Browse Archive.

The suggestion is for:
 * When an Administrators os System Administrators permission is granted, Jira suggest the user to grant the other permissions in one click in the UI.
 * Or make it clear that the Administrators will also probably need the other Global Permissions as well.
fields.summary: When granting Admin permission, grant other Global Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The issue is that the temporary attachments located in <Jira home>/caches/tmp_attachments are not clearing or being deleted.  
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or Edit Issues 
 # Add an attachment to the issue 
 # Cancel creating or editing the issue after adding the attachment

NOTE: This will create a temp file located in <Jira home>/caches/tmp_attachments.
h3. Expected Results

The expectation is that these temp files would be cleared or deleted automatically after canceling the issue. The reason for this expectation is that when you create an issue or edit an issue with an attachment the file is created and removed automatically. 

According to documentation [DefaultTemporaryWebAttachmentsMonitor|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/7.0.4/com/atlassian/jira/web/action/issue/DefaultTemporaryWebAttachmentsMonitor.html], the job should be clearing these tmp files automatically. 
{quote}This class maintains a list of temporary attachments uploaded by a user. When the user's session expires or the user logs out, it is responsible of deleting any temporary files that were not converted to proper attachments.

Since:
 6.4
{quote}
h3. Actual Results

When canceling an issue that you are editing or creating with an attachment the temp file is not removed automatically. When logging out from the user it does not remove the temp file. 
h3. Workaround

There are currently two workarounds for this issue that should delete these files.
 * Removing the files manually or through a task from <Jira home>/caches/tmp_attachments
 * Attempting to stop the Jira instance which should clear the tmp_attachment folder completely.
 ** Stop the Jira instance
 ** Confirm that tmp_attachment folder has been deleted located in<Jira home>/caches/
 ** Start the Jira instance (This should create again the tmp_attachment folder)
fields.summary: Temporary attachments not clearing automatically (tmp_attachments)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If an email is sent to Jira service desk mail handler setup under service desk project>project settings>email request with subject as issue key for Jira software project then it adds a comment to the Jira software project issue key instead of creating  a new ticket 

 

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * I set the "saranbini99@gmail.com" under service desk project>project settings>email request
 * I set up another email "asmaparsayad@gmail.com" under system>incoming mail for my software projects
 * Now I sent an email to "saranbini99@gmail.com" which created a ticket WFWE-2
 * I sent another email to "asmaparsayad@gmail.com" which created another ticket for jira software "SAF-57"
 * Now I created another email with subject "SAF-57 this does not work" and sent this email to ""saranbini99@gmail.com"" and this added comment to my ticket SAF-57 instead of creating new ticket in service desk project 
 * I came across this article but this is for Jira cloud : https://blog.servicerocket.com/adoption/how-jira-really-handles-incoming-mails-this-will-surprise-you

h3. Expected Results

The email channel should be evaluated first. If a ServiceDesk project WFEF has an email channel of saranbini99@gmail.com than issues/comments can only be generated in this project. Emails which mentions other IssueKeys should lead to a new issue in this project with the subject as the issue summary, 
h3. Actual Results

It adds a comment to the Jira software project issue key 
{noformat}
...
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

No workaround available
fields.summary: email sent with jira software project issue key to service desk mail handler adds comment to the jira software issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

There is currently no out-of-the-box post-function in Jira which allows to remove all the linked issue from a given issue during a transition

h3. Suggestion

Implement a new post-function called "Delete issue links" or "Unlink issues" to allow this operation during a transition

h3. Workaround

There are multiple paid add-ons which could be used to automatically delete issue links from an issue during a transition.

Once of them is the paid version of [Automation for Jira|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1215460/automation-for-jira-server?hosting=server&tab=overview]. The solution consists in creating an automation rule which:
- Is *Triggered* when an issue is transitioned from a specific status to another status
- Is using the *Action* "Delete issue links"
 !Screen Shot 2020-11-18 at 12.44.05 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Add a new post-function to unlink issues (or delete linked issues) from an issue during a transition

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary When editing the Jira *Filter Results* macro, the "fields to display" are unable to be edited. They are unable to be removed or sorted. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Use a Confluence instance with an application link to Jira. # Create a new page and add the Jira *Filter Results* macro. # Select the macro and click on Edit. # In the preview pane, at the bottom of the list, click on the cogwheel icon and then Edit. # Attempt to ## Remove a field from the list of Fields to display, by clicking on the bin icon. ## Reorder a field h3. Expected Results The field is removed / reordered from the list. h3. Actual Results Nothing happens, the field stays in the list. Check the attached video [^DeleteField-FilterResultsMacro.mp4] for a recording of the issue's reproduction. h3. Workaround It is possible to remove and reorder fields using an additional plugin from Atlassian Marketplace called 'Source Editor'. # In the Confluence user interface, select 'Confluence Administration' from the top right, then 'Manage Apps' # Click 'Find new apps', and in the search box type in 'Source editor'. # In the search results, find this one : !source-editor-marketplace.png|thumbnail! (You can also find it in the Atlassian Marketplace - [source editor|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210722/confluence-source-editor?hosting=server&tab=overview]) Click 'install' # Wait a few seconds and close the popup that says it's installed # Load the Confluence page with the problematic macro on it # Edit the page (but don't click 'edit' on the macro) # In the top right corner, click on the '<>' icon (Mouseover will show 'Open in source editor') # The example below shows the default columns, plus a new one that I added 'Created': Type, Key, Priority, Summary, Created. # The macro block itself is within the tag: {code:java}

'Filter Results' macro added from Jira:

filter-10002 true filterId=filter-10002&num=10&columnNames=issuetype%7Cissuekey%7Cpriority%7Csummary%7Ccreated&isConfigured=true&refresh=false issuetype|issuekey|priority|summary|created 10 false http:/testmachine.atlassian.com:8080/jira/rest/gadgets/1.0/g/com.atlassian.jira.gadgets:filter-results-gadget/gadgets/filter-results-gadget.xml

{code} # Using the source editor, remove or rearrange the fields/columns that you wish to remove or rearrange from the macro. For example, to remove the 'Created' field, we just need to change the two lines that reference it, changing: {code:java} filterId=filter-10002&num=10&columnNames=issuetype%7Cissuekey%7Cpriority%7Csummary%7Ccreated&isConfigured=true&refresh=false issuetype|issuekey|priority|summary|created {code} To: {code:java} filterId=filter-10002&num=10&columnNames=issuetype%7Cissuekey%7Cpriority%7Csummary&isConfigured=true&refresh=false issuetype|issuekey|priority|summary {code} # Click 'Apply' in the bottom-right corner of the source editor, then 'Update' to save the whole page.
fields.summary: Deleting a field to display (clicking on the Bin icon) or reordering fields does nothing, when editing "Filter Results" gadget as a confluence macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *projectAndUserToSecurityLevelCache* cache ({{com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.projectAndUserToSecurityLevelCache}}) can grow quite large, consuming most of JVM Heap and causing frequent Full GC, potentially leading to OOM and causing Jira to be unavailable.

The size of the cache depends on the number of elements (keys) and the size of each key.
* "Number of elements" is a product of  *# projects* x *# user*, eg, for 100k users and 4k projects, will be _400M_ elements
* "Size" is a product of *# Security Levels*

h3. Environment
 # Have 100K+ users
 # Have 70+ Security Levels
 # Have 4K+ Projects

h3. Expected Results
Cache allocates a reasonable amount of heap, eg. up to 1Gb

h3. Actual Results
* Cache is unbounded 
* We observed cache grows up to 13GB. 

h3. Note on fix 
Cache size is limited to *300k* elements, this can be overwritten by {{jira.project.and.user.to.security.level.cache.max.size}} application property (in _jira-config.properties_ file, see also jpm.xml). 


h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior on Server instances as the cache settings are immutable in the runtime. 

On *DC* the size of cache can be constrained in the runtime by executing: 
{code:java}
ComponentAccessor.getComponent(CacheManager.class)
.getManagedCache("com.atlassian.jira.issue.security.IssueSecurityLevelManagerImpl.projectAndUserToSecurityLevelCache")
.updateMaxEntries(300000)
{code}
We've calculated that the limit of 300000 entries in the cache will constrain its size to about ~4GB max and it still shouldn't create performance issues.
fields.summary: projectAndUserToSecurityLevelCache can cause OOM due to large number of elements

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Connector on step 2 of [Running Jira applications over SSL or HTTPS|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/running-jira-applications-over-ssl-or-https-938847764.html] Advanced Configuration section should have the relaxedPathChars and relaxedQueryChars as it is needed since we updated Tomcat on Jira 8 [per our KB article|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-server-startup-fails-with-tomcat-misconfigured-error-958453799.html]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Copy/paste connector from documentation

h3. Expected Results
Example connector should work

h3. Actual Results
Connector doesn't work as it is missing required parameters

h3. Workaround
Manually fix connector
fields.summary: Connector should have the relaxedPathChars/relaxedQueryChars in the documentation

fields.description: A create link issue is made to the issues opened through the Service Desk. On the board, there is only the information of the records with create link issues, such as storepoint-summary. We request the Service Desk issue key to be included in this field. Otherwise, each issuen should be opened and the service desk number should be checked. Difficulties are experienced because business units transmit their service desk number.
